item.title: Hello, World!
item.description:
program helloworld
print *, "Hello, World!"
end program helloworld

The snippet above is a simple implementation of a “Hello, World!”-program in Fortran. You can try to build and execute it online here! While Fortran may not be the most obvious language to use in 2018 it’s what I am currently working with in a project on numerical physics (where the language still proves superior).

As this is the first post on this site in its current format, I’ll give a brief introduction to it. If you do not already know who I am, you can read a brief bio in my about page.

Despite always having some form of personal website, I’ve rarely posted much else than links to my social media profiles (see main page for links) and hosted static content. And to be honest, I will most likely not regularly post to this site. For social content and short ramblings I mostly use Twitter.

This site will serve as a small digital cross road for my online persona, and contain some random posts from time to time regarding topics that interest me on both a personal and professional level. For the time being, these topics include technology, programming, information security, science and other stuff.

As stated in the footer, this site is built with the static site generator Hugo and uses a forked Coder theme. It is hosted on GitHub Pages, which is configured towards my custom domain.

Until next time (it might be a while),

– Mats

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hi! Welcome to my personal digital corner of the Internet!

I am an IT Infrastructure Engineer and Consultant working in Oslo, Norway. Currently, I am on 4-month educational leave while I am pursuing a master’s thesis within physics and nanoelectronics.

While I am not busy working I enjoy going to concerts and listen to music, jumping out of perfectly good planes, and enjoying life – all while looking out for new things to learn.

I am a supporter of free and open-source software, digital privacy, and an open and democratic Internet.

Contact

If you want to get in touch, @ me on Twitter (DMs open).

For professional or more private inquiries, contact me on:

  • Email: matsest(at)mxe.no
    • For increased security, encrypt your message using my public PGP key or send from a Tutanota account for end-to-end encryption enabled by default.
  • Phone: +47 924 54 560
    • I recommend using an app like Signal (preferred) or WhatsApp as they are free, more secure and reliable than SMS and calls.
  • Keybase chat: matsest
    • Keybase chat offers encrypted chats between anyone without the need of an email address or phone number.


Disclaimer: This is my personal site and content is my own. Views or opinions expressed does not represent employers, institutions or organizations I am or have been associated with, unless explicitly stated. If I redistribute work from others I will to my best effort give appropriate credit.

Privacy: This site does not contain any designated trackers or ads, and no data is collected by me. However – some external content is loaded, which may utilize methods like etag tracking or sending referrer headers back to the provider: fonts (fonts.google.com), icons (fontawesome) and css (cdnjs). I recommend using the Privacy Possum extension in your browser to protect yourself from unnecessary tracking.
